page.title: 03Felixstowe Port Traffic
page.content: Felixstowe has been Britain's largest container port since 1981. In 1984 it handled 495,827 containers. The total tonnage of cargo handled in 1984 was 5,178,195 imported and 3,810,690 exported. In addition 634,828 passengers passed through. Very large ships can be handled. The main harbour channel has been dredged to a minimum depth of 11 metres and the Walton Container Terminal has a depth of 11.8 metres L.W.O.S.T.,deep enough for the largest container ships operating.Containers are moved on and off the ships by rail mounted cranes able to lift 40 tonnes. Trade is worldwide.The port is convenient for Europe and handles much traffic from N.America,but much recent growth has been with Taiwan,Hong Kong,Japan,Singapore,Africa,the Middle East and India.
